snippet: Having conquered the bastions of the military establishment, the Turkish ruling party is now reluctant to press for reforms that could limit its own power.
abstract: Having conquered the bastions of the military establishment, the Turkish ruling party is now reluctant to press for reforms that could limit its own power.
lead_paragraph: ISTANBUL - The Turkish military has long regarded it as part of its job description to guard against the governments it serves. There have been three coups in Turkey since the end of World War II. And though the last one occurred more than 30 years ago, the armed forces have not surrendered their prerogative to call politicians to heel.
